results.name: Sums of ordinal references for a triangular table read by columns, top to bottom.
comment: The ordinal references (i,j) for a triangular table are arranged as follows:

The sequence comprises the sum of each reference in each column, read top to bottom. A similar sequence is A003057, which consists of the sums of the ordinal references for an array read by antidiagonals.
Subtriangle of triangle in A051162. - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 26 2013
First 9 rows coincide with triangle A248110; T(n,k) = A002260(n,k) + n; T(2*n-1,n) = A016789(n-1). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 01 2014
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..125 of triangle, flattened
NRICH discussion thread, Floor Function Identity. [Via Wayback Machine]
formula: a(n) = A002024(n) + A002260(n) = floor(1/2 + sqrt(2n)) + n - (m(m+1)/2) + 1, where m = floor((sqrt(8n+1) - 1) / 2 ). The floor function may be computed directly by using the expression floor(x) = x + (arctan(cot(Pi*x)) / Pi) - 1/2 (equation from nrich.maths.org, see links).
